<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n43jle19nH1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA): </strong><span>I wrote down some of the things IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to be doing for the next couple of months. Basically, I was in a planning state about them. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be sharing more lately.</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been continuing with the contract system update. There are some very exciting little features which will bring a lot more colour to the <em>KSP</em> universe.</span></p>

<p><strong>Marco (Samsonart):</strong> <span>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been doing a little housekeeping in the project, locating unused and deprecated assets to improve our workflow.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Render was good, but 5 shots need to be improved. Full in post-production for the animation.</span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong>This update I’m responsible for 4 new gui systems, which is a new record. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been continuing the work to make sure everything is working as it should. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s funny to think about how many buttons and small things were broken and are now fixed, thanks to the awesome job of the testing team.</span><span></span></p>

<p><span><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps):</strong> Had a fun time helping select winners for the company logo contest. Now on a lovely week long break in Ottawa. Hail Hydra.</span><span></span></p>

<p><strong>Jesus (Chuchito): </strong><span>Going through UDP world, solving bugs.</span><span></span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker): </strong><span>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve worked with </span><span>Kotaku </span><span>for years but thanks to our great community (and our efforts to constantly do right by each of our players), I was quoted by </span><span>Kotaku </span><span><a href="http://goo.gl/xhhPyS"><strong>HERE</strong></a>. </span><span>Rowsdower and Maxmaps spend a lot more time than I do dialoguing with our community but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m paying attention as best I can. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been spending more time on a few boring business things but hopefully, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll have some news to share on that front sooner than later. Dan and I are also talking about brand guidelines, which is fitting coming off the logo contest. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re into branding and logos, be on the lookout because we might try to do some surveying that will help us shore up our brand guidelines for </span><em>Kerbal Space Program</em><span>. Oh yeah, this is my current rocket trying to get into orbit in Career Mode, but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m learning IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m a terrible <a href="http://goo.gl/9rWMtr"><strong>PILOT</strong></a></span><span>. </span></p>

<p><strong>Ted (Ted): </strong><span>The QA Team and I have been testing out the Contracts branch. Additionally, I’ve been continuing with following up on any issues remaining in 0.23.5, which are thankfully looking to be fewer as time goes on. Again, much thanks to those that are writing up bug reports in an accurate, well documented and concise manner, it’s incredibly helpful and really goes a long way in helping us here. (If you need any help in writing up bug reports, check the Bug Tracker subforumÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s sticky.)</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> Presently contacting all the logo contest winners. Once we get emails back, confirm info and gussy things up, we’re fixin’ on announcing everything to the community.<br/></span></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-95ae56c8-67cc-fb15-96d9-12cb4695fa5f"><span>Eduardo (Lalo):</span></strong> Developing some Key Performance Indicators</p>
The only part of the title that was visible on the main forum page was "Devnote Tuesdays: The 'Hail" so I thought it was going to be the "Hail Probe!" edition lol.

Hail Hydra.

?????

Well I guess we know who is, what? I guess a bad guy.

I must say that I thought that the new "Captain America" movie was awesome, but what do I know? I'm sitting here waiting for the "Agents of Shield" which was moved to 9 eastern time for some unknown reason.
I must say that the lack of a Harvester update is interesting. He must be working on something really big!

I must say that the lack of a Harvester update is interesting. He must be working on something really big!

I was thinking the same. Why no word from the leader?
He and C7 have just been really busy and weren't able to submit a blurb by the time this was posted. If I get anything from them, I'll update the post.

I was thinking the same. Why no word from the leader?

I remember them saying that sometimes people dont get an update in before publishing time. Sometimes they just add it later. Or maybe we can expect a Harvester blog post!
"Hail hydra" is from Captain America. Hydra is the the evil organization that had really high tech... stuff.

So is 0.24 going to just a smaller update with just contracts, (because the other planned ones came with ARM), or is it being delayed so another et of features can be added to it?

So is 0.24 going to just a smaller update with just contracts

Small? Contracts? I think you're confusing things.

Great!

I love Devnote Wednesdays!

Small? Contracts? I think you're confusing things.

I meant in relative terms. Some things like improved part joints were planned for 0.24 but have been added in 0.23 instead.

Considering how many buttons and GUI elements Romfarer had to do I doubt it is going to be that small.

Also neither Harvester nor C7 sent what they did this week and those two handle the bulk of the coding besides Mu. Though my guess is they were bugfixing and coding in new contract types.

Just to clarify: have all of the logo winner emails been sent out yet? I'm reluctant to check my email, I don't want to come up empty and think I lost if there's a possibility they haven't been sent out yet.

Anyways, good to hear about the progress, as always!

Lalo is developing KPIs, about what I wonder?

What does he do again? Project manager? He usually writes something really short. Not good for his image imho.
